statement:
It is a basic question in complex analysis to ask when does a
biholomorphic mapping of two domains extend to the boundary. The
following is a celebrated theorem of Fefferman for strongly pseudoconvex
domains.

Let $U, V \subset {\mathbb{C}}^n$ ($n \geq 2$) be two strongly
pseudoconvex domains with smooth ($C^\infty$) boundaries (the boundaries
are smooth submanifolds). Let $f \colon U \to V$ be a biholomorphism.
Then $f$ extends to a smooth diffeomorphism of $\bar{U}$ to $\bar{V}$.

[9]{} Fefferman, Charles. [**]{}. Invent. Math. [**26**]{} (1974), 1–65.
Steven G. Krantz. [**]{}, AMS Chelsea Publishing, Providence, Rhode
Island, 1992.
names: biholomorphisms of strongly pseudoconvex domains extend to the boundary
